question.body: Dr. Brown alluded to some changes Anne could make which would make her bones stronger, why do you think he mentioned calcium?

multiple_choice.choice: Calcium is used as an energy source by bone cells to make bone.
Bone cells (osteocytes) make calcium and deposit it into bone to make it thicker
Calcium is deposited into the bone matrix to make it stronger (more dense).

response.feedback: Incorrect. Calcium is a mineral â€“ ATP is the energy cells use to do work.
Incorrect. Bone cells do not make calcium, it must be ingested through your diet. Bone cells synthesize collagen which is the white protein component of bone.
Correct. Calcium is a hard mineral which gives strength to bones. When bone tissue calcifies, it takes in calcium and hardens to become dense and strong.

part.hint: Remember that calcium is a mineral. It is an important component for bone structure.
